function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["In-person gatherings for learning sessions and webinars can increase the risk of contagious disease transmission among employees.","Staff turnover reduction and engagement initiatives may lead to complacency in following health and safety protocols, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","Travel initiatives, such as sending employees back to their own country, may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if proper health and safety measures are not implemented during travel.","Inadequate training and knowledge sharing may lead to a lack of preparedness for handling contagious diseases like covid-19.","In-person interactions during interviews and onboarding process.","Lack of screening for vendors and visitors.","Lack of clarity around what constitutes acceptable reasons for absence may lead to employees with contagious diseases coming to work.","Lack of clear guidance on non-essential travel may result in employees traveling to high-risk areas and bringing contagious diseases back to the workplace.","In-person meetings and training pose a risk of contagious disease transmission due to close contact and shared spaces.","Employee entertainment events with communal sharing of food and social gatherings pose a risk of contagious disease transmission.","Lack of necessary supplies and cleanliness protocols pose a risk of contagious disease transmission and inadequate containment practices.","Employees not complying with social distancing rules.","Inadequate remote work setup for employees.","Lack of clear communication and understanding of workplace rules.","Non-compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.","Lack of alignment between employee engagement initiatives and health and safety protocols, leading to a compromised environment for disease transmission control.","Potential for contagious diseases to spread through close contact among employees and guests","Lack of awareness and training on contagious disease prevention","Inadequate measures for handling employee illness and isolation","Lack of social distancing and hygiene measures in the workplace","Rapid diagnosis and risk prediction of covid-19 through ai and machine learning algorithms","Use of cloud-based ai-assisted ct service for detecting covid-19 pneumonia","Global availability of open-source deep convolutional neural network design for detecting covid-19 cases","Use of digital technology for quarantine and self-isolation monitoring","Use of ai-powered surveillance for monitoring and restricting public gatherings","Enforcement of quarantine with tracking devices and fines","Use of big data and ai for tracking people and infection spread","Integration of mobile phones and social media for real-time data collection","High transmissibility of covid-19","Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater treatment plant wwtp inflow","Unspecific signal in rt-qpcr testing","Poor removal of sars-cov-2 in conventional activated-sludge wwtp","Incomplete reduction of viral load in wastewater treatment systems","Variability in viral shedding from infected persons and uncertainty in viral gene copies detected in human excreta.","Variations in virus rna recovery affecting correlations","Correlation between measured sars-cov-2 load and estimated covid-19 cases","Optimization of pcr conditions may result in false-positive results.","Untested retention of wastewater samples before the sars-cov-2 pandemic as control.","Possible cross contamination during the purification or rna isolation step","Use of pcr targeting sars-cov-2 rdrp and m-gene in wastewater analysis.","Viral outgrowth assay using caco-2 cells for detecting sars-cov-2 infection in wastewater samples.","Comparison of rt-qpcr primer and probe efficiency for detecting sars-cov-2 genes in wastewater.","Testing sample materials during a pandemic carries the risk of incomplete or inaccurate detection of contagious viruses such as sars-cov-2.","Reliance on pcr assays targeting specific genes for sars-cov-2 detection in wastewater may result in limited virus detection and surveillance.","Higher gene equivalent concentrations in the effluent than the influent due to repartitioning of gene material during wastewater treatment.","Viral rna is not eliminated in the treated wastewater, indicating potential presence of contagious viruses.","Inability to detect infectious sars-cov-2 particles in the treated sewage despite the presence of viral rna fragments.","Positive identification of human sars-cov-2 by means of rt-qpcr"],"non-risks":["Lack of awareness about specific roles and responsibilities","Inadequate time management and organization","Limited knowledge sharing and interaction between colleagues","Lack of recognition and appreciation in the workplace may lead to decreased motivation and job satisfaction.","Ineffective communication and engagement initiatives may lead to emotional repercussions and anxiety among employees.","Restriction of team building and group engagement activities due to social distancing norms","Offsite employees unable to express and share their stories and experiences","Limited communication from leadership due to remote work","Emotional fragility of team members leading to decreased productivity and performance","Potential liability for conduct related to discrimination or harassment","Mental health crisis leading to anxiety, burnout, and other serious conditions among employees","Feelings of loneliness and gratitude among employees affecting mental health and well-being.","Lack of empowerment and support for on-the-ground teams to find solutions for crisis management.","Lack of empathy and understanding from leaders towards employees’ work-life balance concerns","Mental health challenges due to pandemic-related emotional impact","Economic uncertainty affecting employees’ ability to meet basic needs.","Lack of centralized document access and communication may lead to inconsistent understanding of protective measures and infection transmission.","Potential breach of confidential medical information and biased decision-making based on medical conditions may lead to legal and ethical implications.","Prioritizing higher-level employee needs without adequately addressing physiological, safety, and social needs may lead to decreased employee well-being and performance.","Employees returning to the workplace without proper training on new work and cleaning procedures.","Working in pairs or groups without proper precautions and prevention measures.","Lack of dedicated resources to manage prevention measures and ensure compliance.","Lack of comprehensive safety and hygiene training for employees","Inadequate social distancing measures and guest contact protocols","Insufficient food safety standards and protocols","Potential transmission of contagious diseases due to lack of hygiene and cleanliness standards in hotels.","Employees being infected with covid-19","Financial hardship for employees and business partners","Risk of contagion for frontline covid-19 fighters","Suspension of resort operations leading to under-occupancy and potential spread of contagious diseases.","Temporary resort closure leading to financial strain on employees and potential economic impact on the local community.","Lack of clear communication and guidance leading to anxiety and stress among employees.","Health crisis and covid-19 pandemic","High employee engagement and satisfaction levels may lead to complacency and reduced vigilance in maintaining health and safety protocols, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission","Inadequate consideration of the impact of employee initiatives and strategic plans on disease transmission risk within the built environment","Lack of alignment between employee engagement initiatives and health and safety protocols, leading to a compromised environment for disease transmission control","Disengaged employees can impact on the guest experience and the business loses not only money but reputation as a result.","Talent turnover costs the business in both money and time.","Short and long-term mental health challenges for people with mental health problems and frontline responders.","Insecurity and threats of eviction for tenants in informal settlements, exacerbated by the pandemic.","High risk of virus exposure for people with disabilities due to reliance on others and limited ability to self-isolate.","Challenges in accessing services and information for displaced people living in informal settlements.","Gender-specific impacts, including increased caring burdens for women and girls, uneven earning potential, and higher exposure risk for female health workers.","Heightened social tensions and security risks in informal settlements, including criminal activity and strained socioeconomic conditions.","Limited availability of accurate and timely information about covid-19","Integration of digital technology may compromise privacy and data security.","Relying solely on digital technology for pandemic policy and response may lead to a false sense of security.","Unequal access to digital technology may exacerbate disparities in pandemic response and containment.","Socioeconomic inequalities and healthcare disparities amplified by digital health initiatives.","Privacy infringement and increased risk among individuals with mental illness or restricted access to necessities.","Inaccuracy in wastewater treatment plant analyses."]}
